org.jcatapult.email.service
Class FreeMarkerEmailService

java.lang.Object
  org.jcatapult.email.service.FreeMarkerEmailService
All Implemented Interfaces:
EmailService
public class FreeMarkerEmailService
extends Object
implements EmailService

This class implements the EmailService interface and generates emails using FreeMarker. This service is thread safe from the stand point that it doesn't store anything that is not thread safe.

This class takes a configuration instance that can be used to configure the handling of the FreeMarker templates that will be used to generate the emails. Be default this class looks in the web applications /WEB-INF/email directory for the templates, but this can be configured. The template name passed in is assumed to be the same as the name of the FreeMarker file without the ftl file extension. For example, if you have a FreeMarker template named foo.ftl, you would pass into this class the string foo. This makes it easier to assign custom configuration to a specific template. The configuration for each template is documented later.

There are a number of configuration parameters that can be specified to control the behavior of FreeMarker. These are:

NameDescriptionOptionalDefault if optional
jcatapult.email.templates.locationThe location on disk of the email templates. This only works when the web application is deployed in exploded form. Otherwise the FreeMarker templates are searched for via the classpath.Yes/WEB-INF/email
jcatapult.email.templates.cacheA boolean that determines if the email templates should be cached by FreeMarker.Yesfalse
jcatapult.email.templates.check-intervalThe number of seconds to check if the FreeMarker template has been modified. If caching is turned off this value is ignored.Yes N/A

After the templates are found, this class constructs an Email instance by using any information passed into the class as well as any information from the configuration. This makes it easy to set the default from field and other attributes of the email. Here are the configuration paramters that can be set. Note that the <template> is replaced by the template name passed to this class. Also note that this class first uses values passed in and then the values from the configuration.

NameDescriptionOptionalDefault if optional
jcatapult.email.<template>.fromThis specifies from address for the email. YesThe value passed in
jcatapult.email.<template>.toThis specifies to address for the email. YesThe value passed in
jcatapult.email.<template>.subjectThis specifies subject for the email. YesThe value passed in

Constructor Detail

FreeMarkerEmailService

public FreeMarkerEmailService(EmailTransportService emailTransportService,
                              org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration configuration,
                              org.jcatapult.container.ContainerResolver containerResolver,
                              String defaultLocation)
                       throws Exception
Constructs a FreeMarkerEmailService. The transport given is used to send the emails and the configuration given is used to control FreeMarker behavior.

Parameters:
emailTransportService - Used to send emails.
configuration - Used to control FreeMarker.
containerResolver - The ContainerResolver that is used to find email templates in web applications.
defaultLocation - The defaultLocation of the email templates to use. This is passed to the container path resolver.
Throws:
Exception - If FreeMarker initialization failed.
Method Detail

sendEmail

public EmailCommand sendEmail(String template)
Called to build the email using the specified template as the email body, configure the email using the returned EmailCommand object and then send the email using the returned EmailCommand object. Here's an example using the template below named 'hello': 
 Hello ${name},

 Thanks for buying all that cool stuff.

You would call this method like this: 

 sendEmail("hello").withTemplateParam("name", "Joe Blow").to("joe@blow.com").from("info@example.com").now();

Specified by:
sendEmail in interface EmailService
Parameters:
template - (Required) The name of the template. The implementation will dictate the type of template and how they are stored.
Returns:
The name value pair chain.

callTemplate

protected String callTemplate(String templateName,
                              Map<String,Object> parameters)
Processes the FreeMarker template.

Parameters:
templateName - The name of the template file to process.
parameters - The parameters that are passed to the template.
Returns:
The String result of the processing the template.
Throws:
EmailException - If the template couldn't be processed.
